content: [hakon] Hah!
[hakon] Hah, you relic. The gods have been dead a long time.
[hakon] I could use help there.
[hakon] Longer than I did, in any case.
[hakon narrator] Are you worried? Some of the varl in the caravan think the world's coming to an end.
[hakon narrator] Dare I ask?
[hakon narrator] Hence the journal?
[hakon narrator] No?
[hakon narrator] They've got a banner in Arberrang for that, you know.
[hakon narrator] What about the rest of us?
[hakon] Ok, I won't.
[hakon] You knew him well, didn't you?
[narrator] Always rushing around with some important business, but I never /=knew=/ him. Never got a chance to talk much.
[narrator] Another one named Krumr is close, I think, but the addled son of a bitch still welcomes a fight. He'll probably be offed before I am. Although...
[narrator] Anyway, point is what difference does it make? I'm just a delivery bairn for Jorundr now. Can't remember half what I've done.
[narrator] But you're not talking to the right varl. Mogr's got some skill there. Most I can do is hold a quill.
[narrator] Do you know how old I am?
[narrator] Gods, how should I know? Never seen something like this before.
[narrator hakon] Oh, have they? "Old habits", I suppose.
[narrator] Hence? Don't get fancy on my behalf, Hakon.
[narrator] How do you mean? What do I write? I write what happens.
[narrator] I'll take it. If it's the end, I'm ready.
[narrator] I'm competing, you know. Nobody knows how old we varl can get. Naturally.
[narrator] I suppose so. When he spoke, varl listened. I knew that.
[narrator] It tells a broad story. I think there's some value in the narrow. Whose story does it write? Mine? Theirs? Ludin's? ...Gods forbid.
[narrator] I've hoofed more hills than a horseborn with a grudge. Don't worry about me.
[narrator] I've seen worse. They respect you for your ability to swing an axe. They need to respect you for your actions.
[narrator] Others think it's the best thing that could happen. No more black months.
[narrator] There's one by the name of Snorri. He's got a few years on me, just hunkers in Grofheim collecting rime. Bastard might actually beat me.
[narrator] To the depths with you.
[narrator] Vognir? No. Ah, well... I don't know. I remember him.
[narrator] You mean the Long Banner? Yes, the menders wove up something that writes its own history. You want my opinion? I don't trust it.
{skip} mark1=hakon mark2=narrator
/=The scrivener gestures around him as if to remind you of the current situation. You chuckle.=/
/=The scrivener leans back, considering the sentiment.=/
/=You consider what to say next.=/

content.option: What are you always putting down in that journal?
I heard you were a terror in your day
What do you suppose happened to the sun?
Get some rest. Always more marching to do.
